info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:37PM EDT until August 29 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR EASTERN BUTLER...CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHEASTERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 437 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Kittanning, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Kittanning, Ford City, New Bethlehem, West Kittanning, Rural Valley, Worthington, Dayton, West Hills, Hawthorn, Manorville, Ford Cliff, and Applewold. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
